<a id="class_EditorInterface"></a>

# EditorInterface

**Inherits:** [Object](class_object.md)

Redot editor's interface.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**EditorInterface** gives you control over Redot editor's window. It allows customizing the window, saving and (re-)loading scenes, rendering mesh previews, inspecting and editing resources and objects, and provides access to [EditorSettings](class_editorsettings.md), [EditorFileSystem](class_editorfilesystem.md), [EditorResourcePreview](class_editorresourcepreview.md), [ScriptEditor](class_scripteditor.md), the editor viewport, and information about scenes.

\ **Note:** This class shouldn't be instantiated directly. Instead, access the singleton directly by its name.




```gdscript
    var editor_settings = EditorInterface.get_editor_settings()
```

```csharp
    // In C# you can access it via the static Singleton property.
    EditorSettings settings = EditorInterface.Singleton.GetEditorSettings();
```

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_EditorInterface_property_distraction_free_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **distraction_free_mode** [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_property_distraction_free_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_distraction_free_mode**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **is_distraction_free_mode_enabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, enables distraction-free mode which hides side docks to increase the space available for the main view.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_property_movie_maker_enabled"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **movie_maker_enabled** [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_property_movie_maker_enabled)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_movie_maker_enabled**\ (\ value\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ )
- [bool](class_bool.md) **is_movie_maker_enabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the Movie Maker mode is enabled in the editor. See [MovieWriter](class_moviewriter.md) for more information.

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_close_scene"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](class_@globalscope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **close_scene**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_close_scene)

Closes the currently active scene, discarding any pending changes in the process. Returns [@GlobalScope.OK](class_@globalscope.md#class_@GlobalScope_constant_OK) on success or [@GlobalScope.ERR_DOES_NOT_EXIST](class_@globalscope.md#class_@GlobalScope_constant_ERR_DOES_NOT_EXIST) if there is no scene to close.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_edit_node"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **edit_node**\ (\ node\: [Node](class_node.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_edit_node)

Edits the given [Node](class_node.md). The node will be also selected if it's inside the scene tree.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_edit_resource"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **edit_resource**\ (\ resource\: [Resource](class_resource.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_edit_resource)

Edits the given [Resource](class_resource.md). If the resource is a [Script](class_script.md) you can also edit it with [edit_script()](class_editorinterface.md#class_EditorInterface_method_edit_script) to specify the line and column position.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_edit_script"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **edit_script**\ (\ script\: [Script](class_script.md), line\: [int](class_int.md) = -1, column\: [int](class_int.md) = 0, grab_focus\: [bool](class_bool.md) = true\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_edit_script)

Edits the given [Script](class_script.md). The line and column on which to open the script can also be specified. The script will be open with the user-configured editor for the script's language which may be an external editor.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_base_control"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Control](class_control.md) **get_base_control**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_base_control)

Returns the main container of Redot editor's window. For example, you can use it to retrieve the size of the container and place your controls accordingly.

\ **Warning:** Removing and freeing this node will render the editor useless and may cause a crash.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_command_palette"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[EditorCommandPalette](class_editorcommandpalette.md) **get_command_palette**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_command_palette)

Returns the editor's [EditorCommandPalette](class_editorcommandpalette.md) instance.

\ **Warning:** Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_current_directory"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](class_string.md) **get_current_directory**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_current_directory)

Returns the current directory being viewed in the [FileSystemDock](class_filesystemdock.md). If a file is selected, its base directory will be returned using [String.get_base_dir()](class_string.md#class_String_method_get_base_dir) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_current_feature_profile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](class_string.md) **get_current_feature_profile**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_current_feature_profile)

Returns the name of the currently activated feature profile. If the default profile is currently active, an empty string is returned instead.

In order to get a reference to the [EditorFeatureProfile](class_editorfeatureprofile.md), you must load the feature profile using [EditorFeatureProfile.load_from_file()](class_editorfeatureprofile.md#class_EditorFeatureProfile_method_load_from_file).

\ **Note:** Feature profiles created via the user interface are loaded from the ``feature_profiles`` directory, as a file with the ``.profile`` extension. The editor configuration folder can be found by using [EditorPaths.get_config_dir()](class_editorpaths.md#class_EditorPaths_method_get_config_dir).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_current_path"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](class_string.md) **get_current_path**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_current_path)

Returns the current path being viewed in the [FileSystemDock](class_filesystemdock.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_edited_scene_root"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Node](class_node.md) **get_edited_scene_root**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_edited_scene_root)

Returns the edited (current) scene's root [Node](class_node.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_main_screen"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[VBoxContainer](class_vboxcontainer.md) **get_editor_main_screen**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_main_screen)

Returns the editor control responsible for main screen plugins and tools. Use it with plugins that implement [EditorPlugin._has_main_screen()](class_editorplugin.md#class_EditorPlugin_private_method__has_main_screen).

\ **Note:** This node is a [VBoxContainer](class_vboxcontainer.md), which means that if you add a [Control](class_control.md) child to it, you need to set the child's [Control.size_flags_vertical](class_control.md#class_Control_property_size_flags_vertical) to [Control.SIZE_EXPAND_FILL](class_control.md#class_Control_constant_SIZE_EXPAND_FILL) to make it use the full available space.

\ **Warning:** Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_paths"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[EditorPaths](class_editorpaths.md) **get_editor_paths**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_paths)

Returns the [EditorPaths](class_editorpaths.md) singleton.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](class_float.md) **get_editor_scale**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_scale)

Returns the actual scale of the editor UI (``1.0`` being 100% scale). This can be used to adjust position and dimensions of the UI added by plugins.

\ **Note:** This value is set via the [EditorSettings.interface/editor/display_scale](class_editorsettings.md#class_EditorSettings_property_interface/editor/display_scale) and [EditorSettings.interface/editor/custom_display_scale](class_editorsettings.md#class_EditorSettings_property_interface/editor/custom_display_scale) settings. The editor must be restarted for changes to be properly applied.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_settings"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[EditorSettings](class_editorsettings.md) **get_editor_settings**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_settings)

Returns the editor's [EditorSettings](class_editorsettings.md) instance.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_theme"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Theme](class_theme.md) **get_editor_theme**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_theme)

Returns the editor's [Theme](class_theme.md).

\ **Note:** When creating custom editor UI, prefer accessing theme items directly from your GUI nodes using the ``get_theme_*`` methods.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_toaster"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[EditorToaster](class_editortoaster.md) **get_editor_toaster**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_toaster)

Returns the editor's [EditorToaster](class_editortoaster.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_undo_redo"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[EditorUndoRedoManager](class_editorundoredomanager.md) **get_editor_undo_redo**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_undo_redo)

Returns the editor's [EditorUndoRedoManager](class_editorundoredomanager.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_viewport_2d"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[SubViewport](class_subviewport.md) **get_editor_viewport_2d**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_viewport_2d)

Returns the 2D editor [SubViewport](class_subviewport.md). It does not have a camera. Instead, the view transforms are done directly and can be accessed with [Viewport.global_canvas_transform](class_viewport.md#class_Viewport_property_global_canvas_transform).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_viewport_3d"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[SubViewport](class_subviewport.md) **get_editor_viewport_3d**\ (\ idx\: [int](class_int.md) = 0\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_editor_viewport_3d)

Returns the specified 3D editor [SubViewport](class_subviewport.md), from ``0`` to ``3``. The viewport can be used to access the active editor cameras with [Viewport.get_camera_3d()](class_viewport.md#class_Viewport_method_get_camera_3d).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_file_system_dock"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[FileSystemDock](class_filesystemdock.md) **get_file_system_dock**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_get_file_system_dock)

Returns the editor's [FileSystemDock](class_filesystemdock.md) instance.

\ **Warning:** Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_get_inspector"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Returns the editor's [EditorInspector](class_editorinspector.md) instance.

\ **Warning:** Removing and freeing this node will render a part of the editor useless and may cause a crash.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_inspect_object"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **inspect_object**\ (\ object\: [Object](class_object.md), for_property\: [String](class_string.md) = "", inspector_only\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_inspect_object)

Shows the given property on the given `object` in the editor's Inspector dock. If `inspector_only` is ``true``, plugins will not attempt to edit `object`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_is_multi_window_enabled"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **is_multi_window_enabled**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_is_multi_window_enabled)

Returns ``true`` if multiple window support is enabled in the editor. Multiple window support is enabled if *all* of these statements are true:

- [EditorSettings.interface/multi_window/enable](class_editorsettings.md#class_EditorSettings_property_interface/multi_window/enable) is ``true``.

- [EditorSettings.interface/editor/single_window_mode](class_editorsettings.md#class_EditorSettings_property_interface/editor/single_window_mode) is ``false``.

- [Viewport.gui_embed_subwindows](class_viewport.md#class_Viewport_property_gui_embed_subwindows) is ``false``. This is forced to ``true`` on platforms that don't support multiple windows such as Web, or when the ``--single-window`` [command line argument](../tutorials/editor/command_line_tutorial.md) is used.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_is_playing_scene"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **is_playing_scene**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_is_playing_scene)

Returns ``true`` if a scene is currently being played, ``false`` otherwise. Paused scenes are considered as being played.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_is_plugin_enabled"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **is_plugin_enabled**\ (\ plugin\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_is_plugin_enabled)

Returns ``true`` if the specified `plugin` is enabled. The plugin name is the same as its directory name.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_make_mesh_previews"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_play_main_scene"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **play_main_scene**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_play_main_scene)

Plays the main scene.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_create_dialog"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_create_dialog**\ (\ callback\: [Callable](class_callable.md), base_type\: [StringName](class_stringname.md) = "", current_type\: [String](class_string.md) = "", dialog_title\: [String](class_string.md) = "", type_blocklist\: [Array](class_array.md)\[[StringName](class_stringname.md)\] = []\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_create_dialog)

**Experimental:** This method may be changed or removed in future versions.

Pops up an editor dialog for creating an object.

The `callback` must take a single argument of type [StringName](class_stringname.md) which will contain the type name of the selected object or be empty if no item is selected.

The `base_type` specifies the base type of objects to display. For example, if you set this to "Resource", all types derived from [Resource](class_resource.md) will display in the create dialog.

The `current_type` will be passed in the search box of the create dialog, and the specified type can be immediately selected when the dialog pops up. If the `current_type` is not derived from `base_type`, there will be no result of the type in the dialog.

The `dialog_title` allows you to define a custom title for the dialog. This is useful if you want to accurately hint the usage of the dialog. If the `dialog_title` is an empty string, the dialog will use "Create New 'Base Type'" as the default title.

The `type_blocklist` contains a list of type names, and the types in the blocklist will be hidden from the create dialog.

\ **Note:** Trying to list the base type in the `type_blocklist` will hide all types derived from the base type from the create dialog.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_dialog"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_dialog**\ (\ dialog\: [Window](class_window.md), rect\: [Rect2i](class_rect2i.md) = Rect2i(0, 0, 0, 0)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_dialog)

Pops up the `dialog` in the editor UI with [Window.popup_exclusive()](class_window.md#class_Window_method_popup_exclusive). The dialog must have no current parent, otherwise the method fails.

See also [Window.set_unparent_when_invisible()](class_window.md#class_Window_method_set_unparent_when_invisible).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_dialog_centered"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_dialog_centered**\ (\ dialog\: [Window](class_window.md), minsize\: [Vector2i](class_vector2i.md) = Vector2i(0, 0)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_dialog_centered)

Pops up the `dialog` in the editor UI with [Window.popup_exclusive_centered()](class_window.md#class_Window_method_popup_exclusive_centered). The dialog must have no current parent, otherwise the method fails.

See also [Window.set_unparent_when_invisible()](class_window.md#class_Window_method_set_unparent_when_invisible).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_dialog_centered_clamped"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_dialog_centered_clamped**\ (\ dialog\: [Window](class_window.md), minsize\: [Vector2i](class_vector2i.md) = Vector2i(0, 0), fallback_ratio\: [float](class_float.md) = 0.75\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_dialog_centered_clamped)

Pops up the `dialog` in the editor UI with [Window.popup_exclusive_centered_clamped()](class_window.md#class_Window_method_popup_exclusive_centered_clamped). The dialog must have no current parent, otherwise the method fails.

See also [Window.set_unparent_when_invisible()](class_window.md#class_Window_method_set_unparent_when_invisible).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_dialog_centered_ratio"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_dialog_centered_ratio**\ (\ dialog\: [Window](class_window.md), ratio\: [float](class_float.md) = 0.8\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_dialog_centered_ratio)

Pops up the `dialog` in the editor UI with [Window.popup_exclusive_centered_ratio()](class_window.md#class_Window_method_popup_exclusive_centered_ratio). The dialog must have no current parent, otherwise the method fails.

See also [Window.set_unparent_when_invisible()](class_window.md#class_Window_method_set_unparent_when_invisible).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_method_selector"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_method_selector**\ (\ object\: [Object](class_object.md), callback\: [Callable](class_callable.md), current_value\: [String](class_string.md) = ""\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_method_selector)

Pops up an editor dialog for selecting a method from `object`. The `callback` must take a single argument of type [String](class_string.md) which will contain the name of the selected method or be empty if the dialog is canceled. If `current_value` is provided, the method will be selected automatically in the method list, if it exists.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_node_selector"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_node_selector**\ (\ callback\: [Callable](class_callable.md), valid_types\: [Array](class_array.md)\[[StringName](class_stringname.md)\] = [], current_value\: [Node](class_node.md) = null\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_node_selector)

Pops up an editor dialog for selecting a [Node](class_node.md) from the edited scene. The `callback` must take a single argument of type [NodePath](class_nodepath.md). It is called on the selected [NodePath](class_nodepath.md) or the empty path ``^""`` if the dialog is canceled. If `valid_types` is provided, the dialog will only show Nodes that match one of the listed Node types. If `current_value` is provided, the Node will be automatically selected in the tree, if it exists.

\ **Example:** Display the node selection dialog as soon as this node is added to the tree for the first time:

```
    func _ready():
        if Engine.is_editor_hint():
            EditorInterface.popup_node_selector(_on_node_selected, ["Button"])

    func _on_node_selected(node_path):
        if node_path.is_empty():
            print("node selection canceled")
        else:
            print("selected ", node_path)
```

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_property_selector"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_property_selector**\ (\ object\: [Object](class_object.md), callback\: [Callable](class_callable.md), type_filter\: [PackedInt32Array](class_packedint32array.md) = PackedInt32Array(), current_value\: [String](class_string.md) = ""\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_property_selector)

Pops up an editor dialog for selecting properties from `object`. The `callback` must take a single argument of type [NodePath](class_nodepath.md). It is called on the selected property path (see [NodePath.get_as_property_path()](class_nodepath.md#class_NodePath_method_get_as_property_path)) or the empty path ``^""`` if the dialog is canceled. If `type_filter` is provided, the dialog will only show properties that match one of the listed [Variant.Type](class_@globalscope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Variant.Type) values. If `current_value` is provided, the property will be selected automatically in the property list, if it exists.

```
    func _ready():
        if Engine.is_editor_hint():
            EditorInterface.popup_property_selector(this, _on_property_selected, [TYPE_INT])

    func _on_property_selected(property_path):
        if property_path.is_empty():
            print("property selection canceled")
        else:
            print("selected ", property_path)
```

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_popup_quick_open"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **popup_quick_open**\ (\ callback\: [Callable](class_callable.md), base_types\: [Array](class_array.md)\[[StringName](class_stringname.md)\] = []\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_popup_quick_open)

Pops up an editor dialog for quick selecting a resource file. The `callback` must take a single argument of type [String](class_string.md) which will contain the path of the selected resource or be empty if the dialog is canceled. If `base_types` is provided, the dialog will only show resources that match these types. Only types deriving from [Resource](class_resource.md) are supported.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

Reloads the scene at the given path.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_restart_editor"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **restart_editor**\ (\ save\: [bool](class_bool.md) = true\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_restart_editor)

Restarts the editor. This closes the editor and then opens the same project. If `save` is ``true``, the project will be saved before restarting.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_save_scene"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Error](class_@globalscope.md#enum_@GlobalScope_Error) **save_scene**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_save_scene)

Saves the currently active scene. Returns either [@GlobalScope.OK](class_@globalscope.md#class_@GlobalScope_constant_OK) or [@GlobalScope.ERR_CANT_CREATE](class_@globalscope.md#class_@GlobalScope_constant_ERR_CANT_CREATE).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_save_scene_as"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Saves the currently active scene as a file at `path`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_select_file"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **select_file**\ (\ file\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_select_file)

Selects the file, with the path provided by `file`, in the FileSystem dock.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_set_current_feature_profile"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_current_feature_profile**\ (\ profile_name\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_set_current_feature_profile)

Selects and activates the specified feature profile with the given `profile_name`. Set `profile_name` to an empty string to reset to the default feature profile.

A feature profile can be created programmatically using the [EditorFeatureProfile](class_editorfeatureprofile.md) class.

\ **Note:** The feature profile that gets activated must be located in the ``feature_profiles`` directory, as a file with the ``.profile`` extension. If a profile could not be found, an error occurs. The editor configuration folder can be found by using [EditorPaths.get_config_dir()](class_editorpaths.md#class_EditorPaths_method_get_config_dir).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_set_main_screen_editor"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_main_screen_editor**\ (\ name\: [String](class_string.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_set_main_screen_editor)

Sets the editor's current main screen to the one specified in `name`. `name` must match the title of the tab in question exactly (e.g. ``2D``, ``3D``, ``Script``, ``Game``, or ``AssetLib`` for default tabs).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_set_plugin_enabled"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_plugin_enabled**\ (\ plugin\: [String](class_string.md), enabled\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_set_plugin_enabled)

Sets the enabled status of a plugin. The plugin name is the same as its directory name.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_EditorInterface_method_stop_playing_scene"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **stop_playing_scene**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_EditorInterface_method_stop_playing_scene)

Stops the scene that is currently playing.
